summary: bradley wiggins will attempt to break cycling's hour record in june . the four-time olympic champion will race at london's olympic velodrome . wiggins finished his team sky career in the paris-roubaix on sunday .
aspect: 1. Sir Bradley Wiggins to attempt cycling's hour record at London's Olympic Velodrome on June 7. 2. Wiggins aims to add to his accomplishments by riding the furthest distance in 60 minutes. 3. Wiggins will face competition from other cyclists, including Australian Rohan Dennis, who set the current record of 52.491km in February.
explain: Sir Bradley Wiggins, a four-time Olympic champion, will attempt to break cycling's hour record at London's Olympic Velodrome on June 7th. Wiggins aims to not only complete the furthest distance in 60 minutes but also add to his accomplishments within the sport. However, he will face tough competition from other well-known cyclists such as Australian Rohan Dennis, who currently holds the record of 52.491km.
